text: Erigeron sivinskii is a North American species of flowering plant in the daisy family known by the common name Sivinski's fleabane.. It has been found in the southwestern United States, in the states of Arizona and New Mexico.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution mapZion Plant List, United States Department of the Interior, National Park Service The species is named for botanist and forester Robert C. Sivinski.Nesom, Guy L. 1992. Phytologia 71(5): 416–418 Erigeron sivinskii grows on red clay and shale slopes in desert scrub and open pinyon-juniper woodland. It is a small perennial herb rarely more than 8 cm (3.2 inches) tall. The inflorescence generally contains only one flower heads per stem. Each head contains 21–33 ray florets each ray white with a lilac stripe down the middle. These surround many yellow disc florets.Flora of North America, Erigeron sivinskii G. L. Nesom, 1992.
